DataElement.preferredDefinition: Records a text description of method of preparation if the method is not on the list provided.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the orderly sequence of events for a process to make a sample of tissue or blood ready for (transport or) use for research purposes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act or process of making something ready; also a medication made ready for administration; also an anatomic or pathologic specimen made ready and preserved for study.:The mode or manner or orderly sequence of events of a process or procedure. (from STED98)

Concepts.definition: The act or process of making something ready.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Be specific about something; define clearly.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Preservation method not available in Permissible Value list for "preservation method."
